p: Burrowing lowered soil compaction significantly in both the mesic grassland (ANOVA: Chi 2 = 25.62, p < 0.001) and the semi-arid savannah (Chi 2 = 64.85, p < 0.001, Fig. 7, Table 1, Supplementary Table S.7). Impacted area soils were also less compact than soils at the control plots in the mesic grassland, but were more compact in the semi-arid savannah. In contrast, in the arid scrubland there were no significant differences in soil compaction between the microsites (Chi 2 = 2.40, p > 0.1, Fig. 7, Table 1, Supplementary Table S.7). Burrow age class did not significantly affect soil temperature, moisture or compaction at any of the study sites (Supplementary Table S.7).
